column2: 65-74 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
clarkcl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug worked for me while I was pregnant to stop my nausea, but it did make me very tired.  Here's my biggest problem with this drug however: I took it every day for several months when I was pregnant and then just stopped taking it cold turkey when my baby was born (my doctor never told me not to do this).  I experienced a terrible post-partum depression that I believe was brought on by going off of this medication - I just recently found out that phenergan has antipsychotic properties.  My doctor knew I had had problems in the past with depression/anxiety and never told me that I should possibly taper off this drug.  It is was hell.  Be careful.

column2: girlsfly2, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)

It makes me a little sleepy yet if taken w/food, no drowsiness is experienced. Has been a very beneficial drug for me.

column2: mcp2002, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Phenergan works great for me when I have severe vomiting from severe migranes, I have had it both intervenously and in tablet form.  I just want everyone to know the dangers when receiving this drug intervenously.  This drug is to be dilutted and injected very slowly into a iv and not to be administered into a iv in the wrist or hand.   I have severe blood clots in my arm from receiving this medication through and iv.  the nurse did not follow the protocol and injected in very quickly into the iv in my wrist and it was not diluted at all.  Because of this i have a blood clot that goes from my wrist all the way up to my shoulder.  The vascular surgeon said i was lucky that i could have had severe tissue damage and gangreen could have set in and I could have lost my arm.   It has been 7 months since this happened and I still have the blood clot.  and have minimal use of my arm.   Because I do not have insurance I can not have the appropriate procedures done to remove the clots.

column2: 65-74 Female  (Patient)

column2: Kta, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My mother was very sick and went to the ER for fluids, help. She was given fluids and sent home with a prescription for this drug. My dad filled it, she took it around seven PM, then went to bed. An hour later I saw her crawling past my room, Dad in hot pursuit. She was saying she was hungry and wanted to see if she could fix something herself. Dad went in to the kitchen with her, a few minutes later I heard  a commotion. Dad came rushing into my room and asked me for help. Mom was talking incoherently and, not aware of that, was being combatative. I was concerned about the language issue, so began asking her questions. She answered simple questions ok with a few words confused. I then asked her to tell me about some events from the morning so she had to put together a coherent sequence of events. She got part way through ok, and then just lost it and began throwing totally unrelated phrases together, but thought she was making sense. We got her to the ER, the incoherence got worse, but by about ten the next morning, she was again lucid. The hospital kept her for three days, did lots of tests including looking for strokes and have found no reason for her sudden behavior and confusion. This scared the heck out of us. After reading the reviews of it, it should be taken off the market. My mom is 73.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took this throughout my pregnancy and also while recovering from a surgery.  I've taken it both orally and via IV and I have to say, I LOVE it!  I was recently diagnosed with Generalized Anxiety Disorder and now understand why I always turned to phenergan, even when I wasn't nauseous.  It would knock me out for 12-16 hours at a time, and I'd always wake up feeling more calm and relaxed.  I know now that there are better medications more suited to treating anxiety, but phenergan got me through the roughest few months of a teen pregnancy and the aftermath of a horribly botched surgery.  I'd definitely recommend it to anyone needing to get some deep sleep when suffering from anxiety or severe nausea.

My 12 year old has diabetes. When she is nauseous and vomiting this drug works well for preventing ketone build up and a trip to the ER for fluids! She can keep fluids down and maitain a good blood sugar level.

column2: darlingnikki88, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am a former opiate addict (morphine, oxycontin, heroin, hydrocodone, etc) and this was my BEST friend when I was in withdrawal. There are NO OTC nausea meds that work, this is the best thing since sliced bread as far as nausea meds go. I have been clean for 5 years and counting, and I give Phenergan lots of credit for helping me get through the darkest hours of withdrawal. Anyone out there going through this terrible disease, u r in my prayers and just know that there is hope and life after addiction. Most treatment centers will help people with no job or insurance, which is something I wish I had known when I was out there using. Also consider methadone therapy if u can get the money, it saved my life! God bless and stay strong, you are not alone!  :)

column2: VogueIsMe, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My Mom took this & became CRAZY! She saw my deceased Dad & her deceased parents standing in her room & reaching out to pull her up, & than was talking to them out loud. Than she thought she was still in the hospital & had terrable nightmares. She refused to ever go back in her bedroom after that. Than she accused her lovely home nursing aide of threatening her to put her in an institution, than begged me to never do that to her. OMG no-one ever said that to her. (This went on for a week) She got all mixed up on her pills & took Immodium constantly, thinking it was her daily meds. She was arrogant, nasty & mad at everyone. Than she mixed up everything.She slept 22 out of 24 hours a day. It was a nightmare with her. I took her off of that medication & almost everything else too. After about a week Mom was almost back to herself..thank God, although she was still very sick. Unfortunately, our beautiful Mother died 3 weeks ago. Her doctors never saw what was wrong with her until it was too late. It shouted at them in her CT scans & MRI's. They missed it.How bad is that.

column2: MaMa, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This has really helped my so far with my morning sickness.  I am 9 weeks pregnant, and it is knocking out the nausea.  I am extremly tired though after using it.  I am only taking a 1/2 of the 25 mlg tablet and i almost fall asleep at my desk (i'm a teacher). column2: GimpMan, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have taken numerous medications for severe bouts of nausea for over two years now, and Phenegran has been by far the best medication for me.  Initially, this medication will make you feel either drunk or sleepy, but as with most medications, the side-effects will diminish with continued use.  Lastly, given that Phenegran dramatically reduces your breathing, please do not use more than 50 mg unless your doctor has prescribed a higher dose.  Phenegran has been great for eliminating my nausea, and the side-effects will reduce significantly over time.  So, if you have chronic nausea, Phenegran might be a wise choice.

column2: Penelope, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken the pill form of medication for years. I take it for nausea and vomiting associated with migraines. It makes me vomit if I take it with food or migraine medication, on an empty stomach and makes me very tired. The trick is to get some into your system for initial relief which in my case can take 1-3 hours. I take 1/2 of the 25 mg. tablet and usually throw up. Once the nausea is under control take the second 1/2 total 25 mg. Never take more than what is prescribed of this drug is not one to play with. Even if you throw it up some has entered the blood stream!
